alert.note: Alert for Holmes (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 6:21PM EST until March 05 at 11:31AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties in northern Ohio: Ashland, Crawford, Knox, Marion, Morrow, Richland, Holmes and Wyandot. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 621 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall from showers and occasional thunderstorms. Additional periods of heavy rainfall are expected this evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially in low-lying and poor drainage areas, and along creeks and streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Marion, Ashland, Mount Vernon, Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, Mount Gilead, Millersburg, Galion, Shelby, Berlin, Ontario, Lexington, Crestline, Walnut Creek, Loudonville, Fredericktown, New London, Gambier and Cardington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
